# bgit - CLI Tool for Multi-User Git Identity Management

> bgit is a free, open-source command-line tool that manages multiple Git identities. It lets developers switch between work, personal, and client GitHub accounts with a single command, handling SSH keys and git config automatically.

## Core Commands

- bgit init: Initialize bgit on your system
- bgit add: Add a new Git identity (interactive wizard)
- bgit use <alias>: Switch to a different identity
- bgit list: List all configured identities
- bgit active: Show the currently active identity
- bgit clone <url>: Clone a repository with correct SSH config
- bgit workspace: Create workspace folders with automatic identity binding
- bgit bind: Bind current repository to a specific identity
- bgit status: Show current identity status and bindings
- bgit doctor: Diagnose and fix configuration issues
- bgit sync: Validate and fix Git/SSH configuration
- bgit remote fix: Fix repository remote URL for active identity
- bgit delete <alias>: Remove an identity
- bgit update <alias>: Update an identity's SSH key
- bgit uninstall: Safely uninstall bgit

## Key Features

- One-command identity switching between Git accounts
- Workspaces for automatic identity selection by folder
- Automatic SSH key generation and management
- Built-in diagnostics with bgit doctor
- Repository binding for persistent identity assignment
- Cross-platform support (Linux, macOS, Windows)
- Safe uninstall that restores standard Git remote URLs
